reviews.review_msg: Bryan is a great prof! I love that although the content can be dense, he makes the lectures enjoyable and he's really funny. its a tough class that requires a lot of reading and note taking so keep that in mind. But he's a very fair marker and I would highly recommend taking a class with him if you can!

Let's just say, I would not recommend this class to my worse enemy. It's that bad it was. Too much dense info to know per lecture. Extremely hard marking for online discussion. Midterm average was 60%. I took this course because I genuinely wanted to learn about hormones, but aside from cramming all the info in, I don't think I learned much.

He's ok. Not very inspirational or anything but still does a fine job at explaining things. His slides are good; they cover all the important stuff. Online discussions sucked but if you put in the work you'll get the grades. If you need the course he's a fine prof to take it with, but I wouldn't take the course at all unless you need/want to.

I think the 20% discussion is absolutely ridiculous. It's not my job to make sure the Arts students understand the material. Spending time researching and looking for sources to back up things that I already know is such a waste of time. I would not take his class again.
So much potential.

So much material, but Bryan makes it super interesting. Study well in advance for the exams, I found that flashcards helped greatly. Use slides as study guides! Do the online discussion because it's an easy 20%. Even if your group sucks and doesn't post (or, in my case, they all wait until the last minute), do your part and you will get the marks.

Class required a lot of memorization. Midterm was fair but final was brutal. Study in advance for final. Know specifics of everything especially things involved with maternal behavior . Discussions were 20% of the course and the average was 10/20. Your post has to be extremely scientific and well researched to get  a weekly 7/10. No textbook needed

Bryan is a reply nice person. His lectures were always interesting and funny! But that being said if you don't have a big bio background the concepts can be difficult! Nothing to do with Bryan just the nature of the course.

For those of you who enjoyed biological psychology, this course is definitely for you! It seems overwhelming at first, but take your time to read the chapters assigned at your own pace. Make sure to participate in your group's weekly discussions! Attend lectures because he gives helpful hints on what to expect on the exams. Study his slides!

Bryan is really hilarious, energetic & passionate prof. His lectures are usually interesting but sometimes it could be boring. He often focuses on the biological aspect of the course because that's his field. Also, his exams are challenging in my opinion but the assignment is not that bad. Not a tough marker & I did good on his class!

Seemed overwhelming at first (a lot of info), tending to be more neuroscience directed. Pulled out with A- and didn't even bother using the textbook (way too in-depth), his slides are detailed enough. Do the weekly discussions for an easy 20%. Really interesting and thought provoking material about drugs. Best course yet! Bryan is hilarious.

The class was super interesting overall especially if you're in neuroscience. To that end, it can get very science-y at times. Bryan is a neuroscientist at heart so his focus is on that as opposed to the psychological aspects. Definitely an interesting course and worth it for anyone interested in how the brain reacts to different drugs.

The course name is deceiving. Bryan seems to be more interested in teaching a course on the biochemical neuroscience of substance use than anything about psychology. His slides tended towards regurgitating information from the book and he reversed the order the book offers it in which made things difficult to follow. Would not recommend.

Bryan is a laid back teacher, who is absolutely HILARIOUS. His lectures were easy to follow & stay focused during. Would take another class with him. I thought the tests were a bit challenging in that the material has very similar concepts that can be tricky to distinguish during multiple choice. Overall loved the course and professor; very  fair!

I recommend taking the intersession course as you will remember the material better for exams. Overall, Bryan is a laid back professor. Study his slides! They will serve as a guide for what to study in the book. Read the chapters at least once. Midterm was fair, but final went into specifics. Participate in weekly discussions for the easiest 20%!

My gripe was with the Discussion component of this course. It is worth 20% of the final grade, and the only criteria is to make 3 posts of "new" information per lecture. For our group, this devolved to people copy and pasting links to journal articles which they obviously didn't read. Very little discussion about actual course content was fostered.

This class is definitely tough and covers a ton of material. However, it's not awful. I enjoy that Bryan adds a lot of background and politics of the different substances discussed as this made some of the class more accessible for someone such as myself who is actually majoring in sociology. He's also easy on the eyes so that always helps

Bryan is terrible at explaining material. Skims over it, shows you a wall of text on he slides from the book and expects you to teach yourself. Never goes in depth about how systems work, tries to crack jokes to make up for it. The most effort I have ever put into a class for a prof that seems like he couldn't care less. Run.

Loved the class. The course material was interesting, however, there is quite a bit of it. Try not take this course during the intersession, it is very demanding. Bryan was an excellent prof and I would absolutely take another class with him.

Bryan is awesome. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic, can keep class attention. This class might be difficult for those without a solid biopsyc background. Need to study the text well and know details. But far from the hardest university class I've taken. Also he's cute ;)

I had Bryan at UFV and he certainly challenged, in a somewhat unfair manner, my learning. It appeared that he wanted the class average to fall into a low range. Midterm average was 63%. Hard work did not payoff in this class since his assignmnets were difficult to understand and exams were worded in a confusing way. Little help on what to study!

One of the most interesting psych classes I have taken. Prof is very intelligent and enthusiastic in lectures. Also one of the HARDEST classes i've taken in university. I would recommend this class to anyone who is interested in Psychopharmacology and doesn't mind their GPA taking a hit. Material is intense and difficult to wrap you head around.

Excellent prof and definitely one SFU should try to keep around once he receives his PhD. Lectures were information dense (felt exhausted at the end of a few) but he was good at keeping the class entertained and relating the concepts to real world examples. Would jump at the chance to take another class with him.

Bryan is an amazing prof (had him for 383&280)- he's passionate, entertaining and very helpful. Tips for getting a good grade -> watch out for the hints he gives for what'll be on the exam and memorize memorize memorize! Also attend his review sessions as he's quite generous with hints ;) Wish he taught more courses because I love his lectures! :)

Bryan's an awesome prof - super interested in what he's talking about. Is about the only prof able to keep his class engaged for a full three hour lecture. Only a midterm and a final, and they're pretty tough. And he's definitely more attractive than your average prof...helps keep you interested if you're into it

If you have the opportunity to take psycopharmacology with Bryan Jones -- Do it! Easily one of the best classes I've ever taken at SFU. While enjoyable, this is not a 'gimme' class. Hard work will result in high grades; floating through will bring you average results. Either way, the lectures are clear, informative, and enjoyable.
He makes class enjoyable, and the three hour lecture flies by quickly! He pulls a lot of outide info into his lectures which make them really interesting. Great prof, but exams are very tough!

Definitely more attractive than the average psych prof. Likes to go on wild tangents about how much US drug laws suck. Doesn't expect his opinions to be regurgitated on exams generally. Have a strong background in bio psych before taking this class. Learn the first two or three lectures and keep reviewing all semester - key for knowing the rest.

Don't let his stunning good looks and humour fool you into thinking this is an easy course. His exams are rough and you'll have to know things from the textbook and lectures. The outline for the paper is vague but email him and he'll help you out. Lectures are interesting and he answers questions well. He's VERY opinionated on drugs.
Is this a psychopharm class or a rant about US drug policy? Save that stuff for sociology Bryan. Anyway, class wasn't bad, just off topic half the time.
He's very entertaining and makes psychopharmacology really fun! There is a LOT, I mean a LOT to cover in this class so keep your brain sharp! Avg for this class is usually C+.
very opinionated, which is good, except when he wants you to regurgatate his opinion on an exam.
No Comments

Brian's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject. Fun to listen to, but tends to mumble sometimes. However, too much time spent revealing biases as well as a lot of needless slides and info (some lecs. over 130!). Maybe pare it down a bit next time. Tests and marking was fair. Overall quite helpful. Definately recommend this course.
Great prof, excellent class. Need a strong biopsych backgroud, but Bryan makes the info easy to understand and relevant to students. Highly recommended, take this class if you get a chance!
No Comments
Excellent TA, knows his stuff, makes attending tutorial interesting, is a fair marker, and is always available to help you.  Likes to drink beer at the pub.
